question: How much do you agree with the following statement?: I was satisfied with my experiences using the medication dispenser
How much do you agree with the following statement?: I was satisfied with my experiences interacting with the online portal
How much do you agree with the following statement?: Use of the technology caused me to be concerned for my personal safety
How much do you agree with the following statement?: Use of the technology cuased me to be concerned about judgement from friends or family
What difficulties did you experience using the medication dispenser? If you don't feel comfortable answering, type N/A.
What difficulties did you experience using the online portal? If you don't feel comfortable answering, type N/A.

Were there any inaccuracies in the medication or symptom data (at any point did information from the online site not match with your actual dispensation times). If you don't feel comfortable answering, type N/A.
How much do you agree with the following statement?: If I had the option, I would continue using the technology in its current state
If my stated issues with the technology were resolved, I would continue using the technology
In its current state, how much would you be willing to pay each month for a combination of both MedLock's hardware and software? If it is zero be honest!
If all your previously noted issues were resolved, how much would you be willing to pay each month for a combination of both MedLock's hardware and software? If it is zero be honest!
Is there anything you wish the technology did, which it does not do currently? If you don't feel comfortable answering, type N/A.

We genuinely appreciate all the feedback you have given our team. As students, we are hoping more than anything to learn and design a device that can help others. Is there any other constructive feedback you would like to add? If you don't feel comfortable answering, type N/A.
The device/mobile platform made my treatment easier to maintain or access
My device/mobile platform helped alleviate some of the stigma I felt from people around me regarding my treatment
My treatment is improving my health
Counseling is a necessary part of treatment
My medication is a necessary part of my treatment
I feel that my treatment plan is individualized for me, and I can suggest treatment changes to my provider as needed
I felt that data from the dispenser which my provider had access to improved my counseling sessions
I felt that data from the dispenser which my provider had access to improved my medication/prescription schedule
I was able to use data on my personal medication-intake habits or symptoms to improve my own treatment
During the course of the trial, how often did you look at data collected on your symptoms or medication intake

During the course of the trial, how often did you change your habits (behavior, or medication consumption) to improve your treatment over the course of the trial using information gathered from the device?
On average, how many days a week do you believe you missed a dose of medication or take a dose 3 or more hours off when it was prescribed?
If you are being treated for addiction, how many times did you use a non-prescribed drug during the trial?
responses: N/A (not being treated for drug addiction)

question: If you are being treated for addiction, do you see yourself using again?
responses: N/A (not being treated for drug addiction)

question: How much do you agree with the following statement?: Using technology (either as a substitution for, or in addition to regular treatment) like facetime, skype, text messages, or phone calls can be effective.
How would you feel if your physician knew when you took your medications as well as what your symptoms were at that time?
I believe this study had a positive impact
